page.title: 08HOLTON AREA:SHOPPING.SCHOOLS
page.content: Most people go shopping once a week using their own transport.There is one bus on Friday to Lincoln and back,also a free bus once a week to the nearest supermarket,12 miles away.The milkman delivers 3 times a week. A butcher, pork butcher, fishmonger,greengrocer & baker's van call once a week,mobile Library fortnightly.The milk & butcher service is the most used.The farming community eat their main meal at midday with traditional food the norm. Husbands that help in the house are the exception. Their main contribution is decorating D.I.Y. & gardening. 98% of children go to state schools. Lissington & Wickenby children go to Faldingworth Primary until 11 yrs., then De Aston comprehensive.Free transport is provided by Lincolnshire County Council.
